directions: Melt butter in a 9-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar; heat until bubbly. Remove from heat. Arrange pineapple slices and pecans on top.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl; repeat sifting twice more.
Beat white sugar and eggs together in a bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Alternate folding flour mixture and pineapple juice into the egg mixture in 3 portions, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Pour over pineapple slices.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Carefully invert onto a serving platter.
title: Grandma's Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
